Comment: Kanye's bipolar nature and probably being antisemitic has really muddied the message, but the point he's trying to drive home via shock value is pretty interesting. He confirmed it within the past week or so.  He's arguing that liberals will defend it when gangster rap/drill rap contains hyperviolent lyrics about murder, rape, robbery, and drug dealing. Those lyrics are dismissed as "just art" and considered to have no cultural impact, and in fact, they'll even call you racist for saying those lyrics might have an impact on crime rate.  When he puts antisemitic lyrics in his song, it suddenly becomes "normalizing hatred" and a "prelude to violence."  It's a pretty interesting double-standard. Antisemites would say it's *specifically* because it's offensive to Jewish people, but he could have made a song like this about any other group the left considers a "protected class" and it would have had the same result.

Comment: You guys didn't disappoint. Almost thought I was in r/politics .   I myself often question how many of people posting here are actually conservatives. However, going forward, I'll have more empathy towards those people I questioned in the past.   Reddit overall is a cultist group think nightmare. For a while I thought conservatives were a tad better, and had more space for varieties of opinions. But it's all the same mess.  I've lived in super liberal areas, and people who are conservative, like myself, in these places have some spine and some resistance to groupthink. But overall, I guess conservatives really are no better than liberals.  (Good job pushing another one of your own away. Liberals have been ruining themselves that way. Why get left behind?)  I haven't heard a single song of Kanye West, to my knowledge, in my life. I do appreciate someone having the guts to say something that will trigger everyone. I may not agree with them, but I respect the quality of not caring about being liked by people like you.
